BiblioData.Title: SCANNING ION CONDUCTANCE MICROSCOPY FOR THE INVESTIGATION OF LIVING CELLS
BiblioData.Abstract: A method for interrogating a surface using scanning probe microscopy comprises bringing a scanning probe into proximity with the surface and controlling the position of the probe relative to the surface to maintain a constant distance, characterised in that pressure is applied to the surface by a regulated flow of liquid through the probe, with subsequent monitoring of the position of the probe, wherein movement of the probe indicates a consequent movement of the surface.

Claims.P: 1. A method for interrogating a surface using scanning probe microscopy, comprising bringing a scanning probe into proximity with the surface and controlling the position of the probe relative to the surface to maintain a constant distance, characterised in that pressure is applied to the surface by a regulated flow of liquid through the probe, with subsequent monitoring of the position of the probe, wherein movement of the probe indicates a consequent movement of the surface.
2. A method according to claim 1 , wherein positive pressure is applied to the surface.
3. A method according to claim 1 , wherein negative pressure is applied to the surface.
4. A method according to any preceding claim wherein the probe is a micropipette or nanopipette.
5. A method according to any preceding claim, wherein the surface to be interrogated is a cellular or subcellular structure.
6. A method according to any of claims 1 to 4, wherein the surface is that of a liquid.
7. A method according to claim 6, wherein the liquid is an emulsion.
8. A method according to any of claims 1 to 4, wherein the surface is of a non- biological structure.
9. A method according to any preceding claim, wherein the scanning probe microscopy is scanning ion-conductance microscopy.
10. A method according to any preceding claim, for monitoring electrical or mechanical changes in or at the surface.

11. A method for inducing an electrophysiological or chemical change in a cell, comprising bringing a scanning probe into proximity with the cell surface and applying a defined pressure to the surface by means of a regulated flow of liquid through the probe, and monitoring the cell for changes in electrophysiological or chemical signals.
12. A method according to claim 11 , wherein the electrophysiological or chemical signal is associated with an ion channel present on a cell.
13. A method according to claim 11 or claim 12, wherein scanning ion conductance microscopy is used to bring the probe into proximity with the cell.
14. An apparatus for interrogating a surface, comprising a scanning probe microscope, and a means for applying pressure to the surface by a regulated flow of liquid through the probe.
15. An apparatus according to claim 14, wherein the scanning probe microscope is a scanning ion-conductance microscope.
